title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: zuericolors R-Package, provides specific colors according corporate design city Zurich. package contains colors Statistik Stadt Zürich needs creation graphs. two main functions zuericolors: get_zuericolors extracts colors specific color palette puts vector. view_zuericolors prints specific color palette. useful visual inspection. creation CI/CD conform ggplot2 graphs see zueritheme zueriplots repositories.

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: easiest way get zuericolors install repo: Alternatively, download files (clicking ‘Clone download’ / ‘Download Zip’), extract location computer, e.g. Desktop run:

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: check version zuericolors, run:

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
code: library(zuericolors)  # Get all the colors from palette "qual6" get_zuericolors("qual6")  [1] "#3431DE" "#DB247D" "#1D942E" "#FBB900" "#23C3F1" "#FF720C"  # Get first color from palette "div9ntrgry" get_zuericolors("div9ntrgry", nth = 1)  "#A30059"  # Get first four colors from palette "qual12" get_zuericolors("qual12", nth = 1:4)  [1] "#3431DE" "#0A8DF6" "#23C3F1" "#7B4FB7"  # View color palette "qual12" view_zuericolors("qual12")

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: grey color palette palette true sense. However, individual colors needed different features sszviz: LightGry #FAFAFA: light grey scale included use cases data background shaded . PaleGry #EAEAEA: pale grey shade used elements background, shouldn’t completely fade . Currently used color links sankey diagram. Gry #D6D6D6: grey scale included use cases data value shaded . Currently, used color inactive lines coordinated map line chart example. moment, one value. DimGry #B8B8B8: dim grey shade used highlighting elements normally grey (sszvis.scaleGry()). Currently, used highlight color bubble map. MedGry #7C7C7C: medium grey color, standalone value. DeepGry #545454: deep grey color, standalone value.

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: Qualitative palettes used data distinct categories. distinguish categories based color contrast. never used compare values, use sequential divergent palettes case.

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: Sequential palettes used compare values. palettes designed brightness input value.

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: Divergent palettes used compare data two extremes. scales designed brightness input value. come two color variations: valued (red-green) variation used data negative-positive characteristics, neutral (brown-blue) variation used cases valuation wanted.

what: Palettes for Gender, Origin and Marriage
title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: #349894 used women, #FFD736 men, #986AD5 people identify non-binary.  #349894 also used female foreigners (#00615D Swiss female), #FFD736 male foreigners (#DA9C00 Swiss male), #986AD5 foreigners identify non-binary (#5E359A Swiss individuals identify non-binary).  #349894 used depict marriage two women, #FFD736 marriage two men. -sex marriages, general, represented color #3431DE. marriage woman alt=“color palette 9 colors sequential red”unknown partner, #B8B8B8 used, #D6D6D6 used marriage man unknown partner.

title: Statistik Stadt Zuerich Colors (zuericolors)
text: encounter bug, please contact statistik@zuerich.ch.

title: Get Zuericolors Palettes — get_zuericolors
text: Function access color values specific zuericolors palette. see available palettes, call view_zuericolors().

title: Get Zuericolors Palettes — get_zuericolors
text: palette Name specific palette; see available palettes, call view_zuericolors() nth Position specific color palette, optional

title: Get Zuericolors Palettes — get_zuericolors
text: color(s) hex strings

title: Get Zuericolors Palettes — get_zuericolors
code: # Get colors of palette 'qual12' get_zuericolors("qual12") #>  [1] "#3431DE" "#0A8DF6" "#23C3F1" "#7B4FB7" "#DB247D" "#FB737E" "#007C78" #>  [8] "#1F9E31" "#99C32E" "#9A5B01" "#FF720C" "#FBB900"  # Get third color value of palette 'qual12' get_zuericolors("qual12", 3) #> [1] "#23C3F1"  # Get first three color values of palette 'qual12' get_zuericolors("qual12", 1:3) #> [1] "#3431DE" "#0A8DF6" "#23C3F1"

title: Zuericolors Palettes — palettes
text: Available color palettes correspond corporate design city Zurich.

title: Zuericolors Palettes — palettes
text: object class list length 16.

title: View Zuericolors Palettes — view_zuericolors
text: Function visually inspect values colors specific zuericolors palette

title: View Zuericolors Palettes — view_zuericolors
text: palette Name specific palette. provided, palettes plotted.

title: View Zuericolors Palettes — view_zuericolors
text: returns plot requested color/palette
